intro: Schizocarphus gerrardii, commonly known as the Florida schizocarph, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Schizocarphus gerrardii is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
